Description: The first day of the new year.
WhatToDo: People often celebrate the night before and enjoy a day off to relax.

Description: The day after Easter Sunday, celebrating the resurrection of Jesus.
WhatToDo: People often spend time with family and friends, sometimes participating in egg hunts.

Description: A day to celebrate labor and workers' rights.
WhatToDo: Parades and demonstrations are common, and people often enjoy a day off.

Description: Commemorates the end of World War II in Europe.
WhatToDo: Military parades, ceremonies, and commemorations are held to honor those who fought in World War II. People may visit war memorials and attend local events.

Description: Celebrates the ascension of Jesus into heaven.
WhatToDo: Religious services are held, and people often spend time with family.

Description: Celebrates the French National Day, marking the anniversary of the storming of the Bastille during the French Revolution.
WhatToDo: Nationwide celebrations include parades, fireworks, parties, and cultural events. The largest and most notable event is the military parade on the Champs-Élysées in Paris.

Description: The day after Pentecost, celebrating the Holy Spirit's descent upon the disciples.
WhatToDo: People may attend church services and spend time with family.

Description: Commemorates the end of World War II in Europe.
WhatToDo: Military parades, ceremonies, and commemorations are held to honor those who fought in World War II. People may visit war memorials and attend local events.

Description: Commemorates the end of World War I and honors the fallen soldiers.
WhatToDo: Military parades and ceremonies are held, particularly at war memorials and the Tomb of the Unknown Soldier in Paris. People often lay wreaths and observe moments of silence.

Description: Celebrates the assumption of the Virgin Mary into heaven.
WhatToDo: Religious services are held, and people often spend time with family.

Description: A day to honor all the saints and deceased relatives.
WhatToDo: People visit cemeteries to lay flowers on graves.

Description: Celebrates the birth of Jesus Christ.
WhatToDo: People exchange gifts, enjoy festive meals, and spend time with family.
